column4: Although I do have a general, i think, linux question, My hard drive is partitioned, and I can't get it to automatically mount the other partition at bootup... i have to manually do it every time, i remember seeing something to fix this, but after i tried it, it didnt automatically load the partition on the next bootup
oh maybe that will answer both questions

I have no idea what that means
pastebin sudo blkid and sudo fdisk -l

which partition do you want to add to fstab?
The NTFS 67 GB partition..and i want it to mount to /media/disk like it does right now when i manually do it if possible
do I need to unmount the drive before i do this??
no.. give me a bit and i'll have the line you need to insert to fstab
ok thanks
first gksudo gedit /etc/fstab  ..then at the bottom add this line :: UUID=C07404CB7404C5DE /media/disk ntfs-3g defaults,locale=en_US.utf8 0 0
last message was to u :p
you can test it without rebooting.. unmount the drive now.. sudo umount /media/disk then type sudo mount -a  .. if it mounts all worked
fuse: failed to access mountpoint /media/disk: No such file or directory
sudo mkdir /media/disk and then try sudo mount -a again
thanks, that seems to have done it
no problem. enjoy :)
